meanings.sent1: After the fire destroyed the church, the community came together to rededicate the rebuilt sanctuary.
meanings.sent2: Every year on their anniversary, the couple would rededicate their love to each other.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful professor had to rededicate his office key for the third time this month.
meanings.sent4: She decided to rededicate herself to her studies, like a warrior sharpening her sword for battle.
meanings.sent5: The artist would rededicate each brush stroke to the memory of her late mentor.

meanings.definition: To commit or devote oneself again
meanings.sent1: Feeling inspired by the cause, she promised to rededicate herself to helping those in need.
meanings.sent2: After a period of distraction, he knew it was time to rededicate himself to his fitness goals.
meanings.sent3: The cat, after a brief nap, decided to rededicate itself to chasing the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: Just like a phoenix rising from the ashes, she was ready to rededicate herself to her passion for music.
meanings.sent5: The athlete would rededicate each training session to his dream of winning the championship.

meanings.sent1: In their wedding vows, they rededicated their commitment to stand by each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent2: The students gathered to rededicate their support for the school's anti-bullying campaign.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had to rededicate their promise not to eat the last cookie in the jar.
meanings.sent4: As the new year began, she decided to rededicate her resolution to live a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The team captain rededicated his loyalty to his teammates, promising to always have their backs on the field.
